info.title: Zylon-GPT API
info.description:
This API describes Zylon's AI layer's API. The API exposes high-level
primitives that allow developers to build AI apps
and worflows on top of Zylon's Private AI platform.

### Main Concepts
The API covers different functional building blocks:
* Ingestion: /ingest/* APIs allow to incorporate texts and documents
as context for the application. There are two important concepts to understand during ingestion,
that will be used in the rest of APIs:
* Artifact: is the identifier of the file or piece of text being ingested.
* Collection: is used to group artifacts together.

Both `artifact` and `collection` will be used to specify the context to be used
in the different contextual APIs like completions or summarization.
For that filtering, the object ContextFilter is used (see reference at the bottom of this guide).
During ingestion, `metatada` can be specified to, for example, tag documents.
That `metadata` can be used as part of the ContextFilter too.

```json
  "context_filter": {
    "collection": "collection_name",
    "artifacts": [
      "artifact_id_1, artifact_id_2"
    ],
    "metadata_filter": [
      {
        "key": "file_id",
        "operator": "==",
        "value": "artifact_id_1"
      }
    ]
  }
```

* Deletion: /delete is used to remove ingested context.
* Completions: /completions and /chat/completions allow to interact with the LLM
 optionally using the context coming from one or more ingested files.
* Chunks: /chunks runs a semantic retrieval over the selected context given a certain query.
Useful to implement quick semantic search functionalities.
* Embeddings: /embeddings get a vector representation of a given input.
* Recipes: higher-level built-in functional workflows ready to be used.
  * Summarize: given a text or a set of artifacts, and an optional instruction,
will create and return a summary. It is not limited by the context window of the models,
as it internally implements a recursive split+summarize algorithm.
  * Report (beta): given a text or set of artifacts, and an instruction,
will generate a report by first infering the sections of the report based on the instruction,
and later filling in the sections with content from the available context.

### Sync vs Async
All APIs are sync by default. Some of them -the ones that can take more time to execute- have an async version:
* /async/ingest/uri
* /async/delete
* /async/summarize
* /async/report

When an async API is invoked, an asynchronous task is created and queued, and the task id is returned:

```{"task_id":"33732728-d456-4e43-bbbe-6b4e2c2eab2c"}```

Tasks are executed by Zylon workers.

All async APIs have a related endpoint that returns the status of the task and its result, once it is available
* /ingest/tasks/{task_id}
* /delete/tasks/{task_id}
* /summarize/tasks/{task_id}
* /report/tasks/{task_id}

Async tasks can also post updates to an amqp queue
defined in the `callback` property when creating the task.

post.description:
Generate a completion for a given prompt.

We recommend most users use our Chat completions API instead of this endpoint.

The completion can be influenced by:
* A system prompt to set the tone or style of responses
* Context from ingested documents, filtered by collection, artifacts, or metadata

Key Features:
* Context Usage: Enable `use_context` to incorporate knowledge from ingested docs
* Source Attribution: Enable `include_sources` to return used documents
* Citations: Enable `generate_citations` to include references in the response
* Streaming: Enable `stream` for partial updates in real-time
* Use default system prompt: Enable `use_default_prompt` to use a default prompt,
    used by Zylon Workspace

When streaming is enabled, the response follows OpenAI's streaming format:
```json
{
    "id": "12345",
    "object": "completion.chunk",
    "created": 1694268190,
    "model": "private-gpt",
    "choices": [{
        "index": 0,
        "delta": {"content": "Hello"},
        "finish_reason": null
    }]
}
```

Example without context:
```json
{
    "prompt": "How do you fry an egg?",
    "system_prompt": "You are a chef. Be precise.",
    "use_context": false
}
```

Example with context:
```json
{
    "prompt": "Summarize our Q3 sales",
    "use_context": true,
    "generate_citations": true,
    "context_filter": {
        "collection": "financial_reports",
        "artifacts": ["q3_report"]
    },
    "include_sources": true
}
```

Generate a chat completion from a conversation history.

This endpoint enables multi-turn conversations with the AI model, with optional
context from ingested documents and citation support.

Key Features:
* Context Usage: Enable `use_context` to incorporate knowledge from ingested docs
* Source Attribution: Enable `include_sources` to return used documents
* Citations: Enable `generate_citations` to include references in the response
* Streaming: Enable `stream` for partial updates in real-time
* Use default system prompt: Enable `use_default_prompt` to use a default prompt,
    used by Zylon Workspace

The conversation flow can be controlled through:
* Message roles (system, user, assistant)
* Context filtering by collection, artifacts, or metadata
* Citation and source inclusion options


Response Formats:
1. Standard Response:
```json
{
    "id": "chat_12345",
    "object": "completion",
    "created": 1694268190,
    "model": "private-gpt",
    "choices": [{
        "message": {
            "role": "assistant",
            "content": "Here's the answer..."
        },
        "sources": [...],
        "citations": [...],
        "finish_reason": "stop"
    }]
}
```

2. Streaming Response:
```json
{
    "id": "chat_12345",
    "object": "completion.chunk",
    "created": 1694268190,
    "model": "private-gpt",
    "choices": [{
        "delta": {"content": "Here's"},
        "finish_reason": null
    }]
}
```

Example with context and citations:
```json
{
    "messages": [
        {
            "role": "system",
            "content": "You are a financial analyst. Be precise and cite sources."
        },
        {
            "role": "user",
            "content": "What were our Q3 results?"
        }
    ],
    "use_context": true,
    "generate_citations": true,
    "context_filter": {
        "collection": "financial_reports",
        "artifacts": ["q3_2023"]
    },
    "include_sources": true
}
```

Notes:
* Citations are only generated when both `use_context` and `generate_citations`
* Context filters help focus the response on relevant documents

Perform semantic search to find relevant chunks from ingested documents.

Given a `text`, returns the most relevant chunks from the ingested documents.

The returned information can be used to generate prompts that can be
passed to `/completions` or `/chat/completions` APIs.

The max number of chunks to be returned is set using the `limit` param.

Previous and next chunks (pieces of text that appear right before or after in the
document) can be fetched by using the `expand` field. This will retrieve all
surrounding chunks for each relevant chunk, until reaching the default token limit.

The documents being used can be filtered by their metadata using the
`context_filter`. Ingested documents metadata can be found using
`/ingest/list` endpoint. If you want all ingested documents to be used,
remove `context_filter` altogether.

Key Features:
* Semantic Search: Find relevant chunks based on meaning, not just keywords
* Score-based Ranking: Results include similarity scores for comparison
* Adjacent Context: Optionally retrieve surrounding chunks for more context
* Filtered Search: Narrow search to specific collections or documents

The response includes:
* Chunk text
* Source document information
* Similarity score
* Expanded chunks (if requested)
* Chunk metadata

Example Request:
```json
{
    "text": "Q3 2023 sales performance",
    "context_filter": {
        "collection": "financial_reports",
        "artifacts": ["q3_report"],
        "metadata_filter": [
            {
                "key": "department",
                "operator": "==",
                "value": "sales"
            }
        ]
    },
    "limit": 5,
    "expand": true
}
```

Example Response:
```json
{
    "object": "list",
    "model": "private-gpt",
    "data": [
        {
            "object": "context.chunk",
            "score": 0.89,
            "document": {
                "object": "ingest.document",
                "artifact": "q3_report",
                "doc_metadata": {
                    "title": "Q3 2023 Report"
                }
            },
            "text": "Q3 sales increased by 25%...",
            "previous_texts": ["Q2 comparison shows..."],
            "next_texts": ["Regional breakdown..."]
        }
    ]
}
```

Notes:
* Higher scores indicate better semantic matches
* The limit parameter caps the number of primary chunks, not including adjacent ones
* Enable expansion, can increase how much time it takes to return results

Retrieve the full content of filtered documents.

This endpoint provides access to complete document content rather than
semantic chunks. It's useful when you need the entire context of documents
rather than relevant excerpts.

Key Features:
* Full Content: Get complete documents rather than chunks
* Filtered Retrieval: Select specific documents using metadata filters
* Bulk Retrieval: Get multiple documents in one request

Example Request:
```json
{
    "context_filter": {
        "collection": "reports",
        "artifacts": ["annual_report_2023"],
        "metadata_filter": [
            {
                "key": "department",
                "operator": "==",
                "value": "finance"
            }
        ]
    }
}
```

Example Response:
```json
[
    {
        "artifact_id": "annual_report_2023",
        "content": "Full document content..."
    }
]
```

Notes:
* This endpoint returns unprocessed document content
* Large documents may impact response time
* Use the chunks endpoint instead if you only need relevant excerpts
Deprecated endpoint for file ingestion. Use /ingest/file instead.

Ingests and processes a file, storing its chunks to be used as context.

The context obtained from files is later used in
`/chat/completions`, `/completions`, and `/chunks` APIs.

Most common document
formats are supported, but you may be prompted to install an extra dependency to
manage a specific file type.

A file can generate different Documents (for example a PDF generates one Document
per page). All Documents are returned in the response, together with the
extracted Metadata, which is later used to improve context retrieval and
can be used to filter the context used to create responses in
`/chat/completions`, `/completions`, and `/chunks` and `/content` APIs.

Example Response:
```json
{
    "object": "list",
    "model": "private-gpt",
    "data": [
        {
            "object": "ingest.document",
            "artifact": "quarterly_report",
            "doc_metadata": {
                "file_name": "Q3_Report.pdf",
                "page_number": 1,
                "total_pages": 10
            }
        }
    ]
}
```

Notes:
* File size limits may apply
* Ingested content is immediately available for other APIs
* The artifact ID should be unique within the collection

422.description: Invalid file format or request parameters

post.description:
Ingests and processes a text, storing its chunks to be used as context.

The context obtained from files is later used in
`/chat/completions`, `/completions`, and `/chunks` APIs.

A Document will be generated with the given text. The Document
ID is returned in the response, together with the
extracted Metadata (which is later used to improve context retrieval). That ID
can be used to filter the context used to create responses in
`/chat/completions`, `/completions`, and `/chunks` and `/content` APIs.

Example Request:
```json
{
    "artifact": "company_profile",
    "collection": "corporate_docs",
    "text": "Our company was founded in 2020...",
    "metadata": {}
}
```

Notes:
* Text is automatically split into optimal chunks
* The artifact ID should be unique within the collection

Ingest and process a file from a URI location.

This endpoint allows ingestion of files from remote locations using URIs,
such as S3 buckets or public URLs.

The context obtained from files is later used in
`/chat/completions`, `/completions`, and `/chunks` APIs.

A Document will be generated with the given text. The Document
ID is returned in the response, together with the
extracted Metadata (which is later used to improve context retrieval). That ID
can be used to filter the context used to create responses in
`/chat/completions`, `/completions`, `/chunks` and `/content` APIs.

Example Request:
```json
{
    "uri": "s3://company-docs/reports/annual-2023.pdf",
    "artifact": "annual_report_2023",
    "collection": "financial_reports",
    "metadata": {
        "file_name": "annual-2023.pdf",
        "year": "2023",
        "type": "annual_report"
    }
}
```

Notes:
* Proper access permissions to the URI are required
* File name with extension is required in metadata
* The artifact ID should be unique within the collection
* URI must be accessible from the server

get.description:
List all documents ingested into the system.

This endpoint provides an overview of all ingested documents and their
associated metadata, useful for understanding available context and
filtering options.

Key Features:
* Collection Filtering: View documents in specific collections
* Metadata Access: See all stored document properties
* Context Planning: Plan AI interactions based on available content

Example Response:
```json
{
    "object": "list",
    "model": "private-gpt",
    "data": [
        {
            "object": "ingest.document",
            "artifact": "annual_report",
            "doc_metadata": {
                "file_name": "2023_Annual.pdf",
                "department": "finance",
                "date": "2023-12-31"
            }
        }
    ]
}
```

The returned information can be used to:
* Filter context in chat and completion APIs
* Track ingested documents
* Verify document metadata
* Plan document organization

post.description:
Delete a specific document from the system.

This endpoint removes a document and all its associated chunks and metadata
from the system.

Key Features:
* Complete Removal: Deletes document content and metadata
* Collection Specific: Targets documents in specific collections
* Immediate Effect: Content is no longer available for context

Example Request:
```json
{
    "collection": "financial_reports",
    "artifact": "q2_2023_report"
}
```

Notes:
* Operation cannot be undone
* Affects all APIs using the document as context
* Consider using async version for large documents

Asynchronously process and ingest a document from a URI location.

This endpoint initiates an asynchronous task to download, process, and ingest
a document from a remote URI. It's particularly useful for large files.

The context obtained from files is later used in
`/chat/completions`, `/completions`, and `/chunks` APIs.

A file can generate different Documents (for example a PDF generates one Document
per page). All Documents are returned in the response, together with the
extracted Metadata and artifact id, which is later used to improve context retrieval
and can be used to filter the context used to create responses in
`/chat/completions`, `/completions`, `/chunks` and `/content` APIs.

Example request:
```json
{
    "callback": {
        "amqp": {
            "exchange": "ingestion",
            "routing_key_done": "ingest.done",
            "routing_key_error": "ingest.error",
            "routing_key_progress": "ingest.progress"
        }
    },
    "ingest_body": {
        "uri": "https://example.com/docs/report.pdf",
        "artifact": "annual_report_2023",
        "collection": "financial_reports",
        "metadata": {
            "file_name": "annual_report_2023.pdf",
            "department": "finance",
            "year": "2023"
        }
    }
}
```

Notes:
* URI must be accessible from the server
* File name with extension is required in metadata
* PDFs generate one document per page
* Large files are automatically split into chunks
* Progress can be monitored via /ingest/tasks/{task_id}
* Resulting context is available in chat/completion APIs
* Ingested content can be filtered using metadata

Asynchronously remove a document and its associated data from the system.

This endpoint initiates an asynchronous task to delete a document and returns
a task ID for status tracking. This is particularly useful for large documents
or when dealing with multiple document components. The task ID can be "revoked"
if this task doesn't have impact on the system.

Key Features:
* Asynchronous Processing: Non-blocking deletion of large documents
* Task Tracking: Monitor deletion progress
* Background Execution: Server handles deletion without blocking
* Status Updates: Check progress via task ID

Example request:
```json
{
    "callback": {
        "amqp": {
            "exchange": "deletions",
            "routing_key_done": "delete.done",
            "routing_key_error": "delete.error",
            "routing_key_progress": "delete.progress"
        }
    },
    "delete_body": {
        "collection": "financial_reports",
        "artifact": "2022_annual_report"
    }
}
```

Notes:
* Task progress can be monitored via /delete/tasks/{task_id}
* Deletion cannot be undone once completed
* Consider sync deletion for small documents

get.description:
Get the status of an asynchronous deletion task.

Response includes:
* task_id: The ID of the task
* task_status: Current status (pending, running, completed, failed)
* task_result: None for deletion tasks

Example response:
```json
{
    "task_id": "123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000",
    "task_status": "completed",
    "task_result": null
}
```

post.summary: Generate a summary of text or documents
post.description:
Generate a summary from provided text or ingested documents.

This endpoint provides flexible summarization capabilities with options for
custom instructions, context integration, and streaming responses.

Key Features:
* Text or Context: Summarize provided text or use ingested documents
* Custom Instructions: Guide the summary generation with specific instructions
* Context Integration: Use content from ingested documents as reference material
* Streaming: Get real-time updates during summary generation
* Custom Prompts: Override default summarization prompt if needed

Example with direct text:
```json
{
    "text": "The quarterly report shows a 15% increase in revenue...",
    "instructions": "Focus on key business metrics",
    "use_context": false
}
```

Example with context:
```json
{
    "use_context": true,
    "context_filter": {
        "collection": "financial_reports",
        "artifacts": ["q4_report"]
    },
    "instructions": "Summarize Q4 performance",
    "stream": true
}
```

Example with custom prompt:
```json
{
    "text": "Technical specification document...",
    "prompt": "Create a technical summary highlighting key system requirements",
    "additional_instructions": ["Focus on performance requirements"]
}
```

get.description:
Get the status and result of an asynchronous summary generation task.

The response includes:
* task_id: The ID of the task
* task_status: Current status (pending, running, completed, failed)
* task_result: The generated summary if the task is completed

post.description:
Generate vector embeddings from input text.

This endpoint converts text into high-dimensional vector representations that
capture semantic meaning. These embeddings can be used for
various machine learning tasks like semantic search, clustering, or classification.

Key Features:
* Single or Batch Processing: Generate embeddings for one text or multiple texts
* Consistent Dimensionality: All embeddings have the same vector dimensions
* Semantic Capture: Embeddings preserve semantic relationships between texts

Example with single text:
```json
{
    "input": "The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog"
}
```

Example with multiple texts:
```json
{
    "input": [
        "Machine learning is fascinating",
        "Neural networks process data efficiently",
        "Embeddings represent text as vectors"
    ]
}
```

The response includes:
```json
{
    "object": "list",
    "model": "private-gpt",
    "data": [
        {
            "index": 0,
            "object": "embedding",
            "embedding": [0.123, -0.456, 0.789, ...]
        },
        ...
    ]
}
```

Generate a structured report based on provided instructions.

Given a set of instructions, generate a structured report.

The report generation can be customized with instructions
and can incorporate context from previously ingested documents.

Key Features:
* Custom Instructions: Provide primary and additional
instructions to guide report generation
* Context Integration: Use content from ingested documents as reference material
* Flexible Filtering: Filter source documents by collection, artifacts, or metadata
* Markdown Output: Returns the report in markdown format for easy rendering

Examples:
```json
{
    "instructions": "Analyze Q4 2023 sales performance",
    "additional_instructions": [
        "Focus on regional comparisons",
        "Include year-over-year metrics"
    ],
    "use_context": true,
    "context_filter": {
        "collection": "financial_reports",
        "artifacts": ["q4_2023_report"]
    }
}
```

Without context:
```json
{
    "instructions": "Create a project status report template",
    "additional_instructions": ["Include risk assessment section"],
    "use_context": false
}
```

get.description:
Get the status and result of an asynchronous report generation task.

The response includes:
* task_id: The ID of the task
* task_status: Current status (pending, running, completed, failed)
* task_result: The generated report if the task is completed

post.summary: Queries the RAG model with a given query and context.
post.description:
Perform a Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) query.

Given a query and context, this endpoint retrieves relevant context
from ingested documents and generates a response based on that context.

Key Features:
* Smart Input: Provide context either as direct text
    or reference to ingested documents.
* Top-K Retrieval: Control the number of relevant chunks to use as context. It will
    expand until configured context window.
* Source Tracing: Returns the specific document chunks used to generate the response
* Customizable Prompts: Use custom instructions to guide the generation

Example request:
```json
{
    "prompt": "Answer the query based on the provided context.",
    "query": "What are the key financial metrics for Q1?",
    "artifact_input": {"type": "text", "value": "financial reports"},
    "top_k": 5
}
```

PD. RAG only works with Ingested files.

post.summary: Queries the RAG model with a given query and context.
post.description:
Perform multiple RAG queries in a single request.

This endpoint allows for batch processing of multiple RAG queries,
which is more efficient than making separate requests.

Key Features:
* Batch Processing: Submit multiple queries in a single request
* Correlation IDs: Track each query batch with custom identifiers
* Unified Context: All queries in a batch can share the same context
* Efficient Resource Usage: More efficient for processing many similar queries

Example request:
```json
[
    {
        "prompt": "Answer the queries based on the provided context.",
        "queries": [
            "What are the key financial metrics for Q1?",
            "How did Q2 compare to Q1?"
        ],
        "artifact_input": {"type": "text", "value": "financial reports"},
        "top_k": 5,
        "correlation_id": "batch-123"
    },
    {
        "prompt": "Summarize the following information.",
        "queries": [
            "What were the major market trends in 2023?"
        ],
        "artifact_input": {"type": "text", "value": "market analysis"},
        "top_k": 3,
        "correlation_id": "batch-456"
    }
]
```
    PD. RAG only works with Ingested files.

post.summary: Queries the RAG model with a given query and context.
post.description:
Create an asynchronous task for a RAG query.

This endpoint creates an asynchronous task for a RAG query and returns
a task ID that can be used to check the status and retrieve results.

Key Differences from Sync API:
* Returns immediately with a task ID
* Suitable for long-running or resource-intensive queries
* Can use callback mechanisms for notification when complete
* Status can be checked via task status endpoints

Example request:
```json
{
    "callback": {
        "amqp": {
            "exchange": "rag_queries",
            "routing_key_done": "rag.done",
            "routing_key_error": "rag.error"
        }
    },
    "rag_body": {
        "prompt": "Provide a detailed analysis based on the context.",
        "query": "What are the strategic implications of the Q3 results?",
        "artifact_input": {"type": "text", "value": "quarterly reports"},
        "top_k": 15
    }
}
```

PD. RAG only works with Ingested files.

ContextFilter.title: ContextFilter
ContextFilter.description:
Filter by collection, artifacts and metadata in the ingested context.

The main filter is the collection the context is part of.

All artifacts ids are ensured to be part of the context. If any of the ids is not
usable in the context (i.e. doesn't exist), the related task will fail.

The metadata filter will look for all context matching the metadata, if any, and
add it to the context. The filter is a dictionary of key-value pairs.
The key is the metadata key, and the value is the metadata value.

If both artifacts and metadata filters are provided, the result will be the
intersection of the two filters.
